args.name: path
args.comment: The file containing the geomagnetic model data.

args.name: day
args.comment: The day in the month, i.e. in [1,31].

args.name: month
args.comment: The month of the year, i.e. in [1, 12].

args.name: line
args.comment: The line in the data file where an error occured, or NULL.

gull_snapshot_create.argline: struct gull_snapshot **snapshot, const char *path, int day, int month, int year, int *line

return.comment: On success PUMAS_RETURN_SUCCESS is returned otherwise an error code is returned as detailed below.

gull_snapshot_create.description: Create a snapshot of a geomagnetic model.
gull_snapshot_create.comments:
Create a snapshot of a geomagnetic model at the given date (day, month, year) from the spherical harmonic coefficients loaded from path. If line is not NULL and a parsing error occured in path the corresponding line number is filled. See below for a list of supported data formats.

Data formats

 *.COF    From **geomag70**. List of coefficients grouped by year, with a header, e.g. IGRF12.COF or WWM2015.COF.

Error codes

 GULL_RETURN_MEMORY_ERROR     Couldn't allocate memory.

 GULL_RETURN_PATH_ERROR       The data file couldn't be found/opened.

 GULL_RETURN_MISSING_DATA     There is no valid data for the requested date.

gull_snapshot_destroy.comments: Fully destroy a snapshot and free any allocated memory.

args.name: altitude
args.comment: The altitude (m) above the reference ellipsoid (WGS84).

gull_snapshot_field.argline: struct gull_snapshot *snapshot, double latitude, double longitude, double altitude, double [3] magnet

return.comment: On success PUMAS_RETURN_SUCCESS is returned otherwise an error code is returned as detailed below.

gull_snapshot_field.comments:
Compute the geomagnetic field components in East, North, Upward (ENU) from a snapshot, at a given location on Earth.

Error codes

 GULL_RETURN_DOMAIN_ERROR    The provided altitude is not valid.

args.name: order
args.comment: The order used for spherical harmonics.

args.name: altitude_min
args.comment: The minimum altitude (m) at which the model is valid.

args.name: altitude_max
args.comment: The maximum altitude (m) at which the model is valid.

gull_snapshot_info.comments: Get some basic information on a geomagnetic snapshot. Note that any output parameter can be set to NULL if the corresponding property is not needed.

gull_error_string.comments: This function is analog to the standard C strerror function but specific to GULL return codes. Contrary to its standard library analog it is thread safe.

gull_error_function.description: Return a string describing a GULL library function.
gull_error_function.comments: This function is meant for verbosing when handling errors.

return.comment: The current error handler or NULL if none.

args.name: handler
args.comment: The error handler to set or NULL.

gull_error_handler_set.comments:
Set the error handler callback for GULL library functions. If handler is set to NULL error callbacks are disabled.

Warnings

This function is not thread safe.

gull_function_t.comments: This is a generic function pointer used to identify the library functions, e.g. for error handling.

args.name: caller
args.comment: The caller function where the error occured.

gull_handler_cb.argline: enum gull_return rc, gull_function_t *caller, const char *file, int line
gull_handler_cb.comments:
The user might provide its own error handler. It will be called at the return of any GULL library function providing an error code.

Warnings

This callback must be thread safe if GULL is used in multithreaded applications.

types.block:
GULL_RETURN_SUCCESS
GULL_RETURN_DOMAIN_ERROR
GULL_RETURN_FORMAT_ERROR
GULL_RETURN_MEMORY_ERROR
GULL_RETURN_MISSING_DATA
GULL_RETURN_PATH_ERROR
GULL_N_RETURNS

fields.name: GULL_RETURN_DOMAIN_ERROR
fields.comments: Some input value is out of its validity range.

fields.name: GULL_RETURN_FORMAT_ERROR
fields.comments: A provided file has a wrong format.

fields.name: GULL_RETURN_PATH_ERROR
fields.comments: A file couldn't be opened or found.

types.description: Opaque structure for handling snapshots of the geomagnetic field.
